N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX




Physics
Standard level
Paper 1


Tuesday 30 October 2018 (afternoon)


45 minutes


Instructions to candidates
• Do not open this examination paper until instructed to do so.
• Answer all the questions.
• For each question, choose the answer you consider to be the best and indicate your choice on
  the answer sheet provided.
• A clean copy of the physics data booklet is required for this paper.
• The maximum mark for this examination paper is [30 marks].




                                                                                             8818 – 6504
     17 pages                                            © International Baccalaureate Organization 2018
                                                   –2–                   N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

1.   What is the unit of power expressed in fundamental SI units?

     A.    kg m s–2

     B.    kg m2 s–2

     C.    kg m s–3

     D.    kg m2 s–3


2.   The length of the side of a cube is 2.0 cm ± 4 %.  The mass of the cube is 24.0 g ± 8 %.  What is the
     percentage uncertainty of the density of the cube?

     A.    ±2 %

     B.    ±8 %

     C.    ± 12 %

     D.    ± 20 %


3.   A truck has an initial speed of 20 m s–1.  It decelerates at 4.0 m s–2. What is the distance taken by
     the truck to stop?

     A.    2.5 m

     B.    5.0 m

     C.    50 m

     D.    100 m
                                                     –3–                   N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

4.   A projectile is fired at an angle to the horizontal.  Air resistance is negligible.  The path of the
     projectile is shown.




                     vertical displacement / m 20
                                                                      O
                                                  10

                                                                                      P
                                                    0
                                                        0        20          40           60
                                                            horizontal displacement / m

     Which gives the magnitude of the horizontal component and the magnitude of the
     vertical component of the velocity of the projectile between O and P?

                        Magnitude of                                   Magnitude of
              horizontal component of velocity               vertical component of velocity

     A.                     constant                                      increases

     B.                     constant                                      constant

     C.                     increases                                     increases

     D.                     increases                                     constant




                                                                                                     Turn over
                                                 –4–                  N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

5.   A runner starts from rest and accelerates at a constant rate throughout a race. Which graph shows
     the variation of speed v of the runner with distance travelled s?

     A.                                                B.
          v                                                 v




          0                                                 0
              0                    s                            0                   s



     C.                                                D.
          v                                                 v




          0                                                 0
              0                    s                            0                   s



6.   Two blocks X and Y rest on a frictionless horizontal surface as shown.  A horizontal force
     is now applied to the larger block and the two blocks move together with the same speed
     and acceleration.


                                                      X

                                                      Y



     Which free-body diagram shows the frictional forces between the two blocks?

     A.            X                           B.               X
                   Y                                            Y



     C.            X                           D.               X
                   Y                                            Y
                                                 –5–                  N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

7.   The mass at the end of a pendulum is made to move in a horizontal circle of radius r at
     constant speed.  The magnitude of the net force on the mass is F.




                                                 r


     What is the direction of F and the work done by F during half a revolution?

                     Direction of F           Work done by F

     A.         towards centre of circle             zero

     B.         towards centre of circle             πrF

     C.         away from centre of circle           zero

     D.         away from centre of circle           πrF



8.   A compressed spring is used to launch an object along a horizontal frictionless surface.  When the
     spring is compressed through a distance x and released, the object leaves the spring at speed v.
     What is the distance through which the spring must be compressed for the object to leave the
                v
     spring at ?
                2

                                                       x




                                                                       v


           x
     A.
           4

           x
     B.
           2

            x
     C.
               2

     D.    x 2

                                                                                               Turn over
                                                   –6–                   N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

9.    A ball of mass m collides with a wall and bounces back in a straight line. The ball loses 75 % of
      the initial energy during the collision. The speed before the collision is v.

                                                                 wall

                                         m
                                              v




      What is the magnitude of the impulse on the ball by the wall?

                   3
      A.     1 −     mv
                  2 

            1
      B.      mv
            2

            5
      C.      mv
            4

            3
      D.      mv
            2


10.   A 700 W electric heater is used to heat 1 kg of water without energy losses.  The specific heat
      capacity of water is 4.2 kJ kg–1 K–1. What is the time taken to heat the water from 25 °C to 95 °C?

      A.    7s

      B.    30 s

      C.    7 minutes

      D.    420 minutes
                                                   –7–                  N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

11.   A container is filled with a mixture of helium and oxygen at the same temperature.  The molar mass
      of helium is 4 g mol–1 and that of oxygen is 32 g mol–1.

                          average speed of helium molecules
      What is the ratio                                     ?
                          average speed of oxygen molecules

            1
      A.
            8

             1
      B.
             8

      C.        8

      D.    8


12.   Container X contains 1.0 mol of an ideal gas.  Container Y contains 2.0 mol of the ideal gas.  
      Y has four times the volume of X. The pressure in X is twice that in Y.

                temperature of gas in X
      What is                           ?
                temperature of gas in Y

            1
      A.
            4

            1
      B.
            2

      C.    1

      D.    2


13.   A particle moving in a circle completes 5 revolutions in 3 s.  What is the frequency?

            3
      A.      Hz
            5

            5
      B.      Hz
            3

            3π
      C.       Hz
             5

            5π
      D.       Hz
             3




                                                                                                Turn over
                                                 –8–                  N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

14.   A longitudinal wave moves through a medium. Relative to the direction of energy transfer through
      the medium, what are the displacement of the medium and the direction of propagation of
      the wave?

               Displacement of medium            Direction of propagation of wave

      A.               parallel                            perpendicular

      B.               parallel                            parallel

      C.               perpendicular                       parallel

      D.               perpendicular                       perpendicular



15.   The graphs show the variation of the displacement y of a medium with distance x and with time t
      for a travelling wave.

                         y / cm
                              4


                              0
                                  0      4           8                         x/m

                            –4



                         y / cm
                              4


                              0
                                  0          5           10                   t / ms

                            –4



      What is the speed of the wave?

      A.   0.6 m s–1

      B.   0.8 m s–1

      C.   600 m s–1

      D.   800 m s–1
                                                   –9–                   N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

16.   In a double-slit experiment, a source of monochromatic red light is incident on slits S1 and
      S2 separated by a distance d.  A screen is located at distance x from the slits.  A pattern with
      fringe spacing y is observed on the screen.

                                      slits                             screen            not to scale




                                         S1

                                                                            y
                                  d


                                         S2
           red monochromatic
                source




                                                        x


      Three changes are possible for this arrangement

		I.               increasing x
		II.              increasing d
		          III.   using green monochromatic light instead of red.

      Which changes will cause a decrease in fringe spacing y ?

      A.    I and II only

      B.    I and III only

      C.    II and III only

      D.    I, II, and III




                                                                                                  Turn over
                                                    – 10 –                N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

17.   Two strings of lengths L1 and L2 are fixed at both ends.  The wavespeed is the same for
      both strings.  They both vibrate at the same frequency.  L1 vibrates at its first harmonic.  
      L2 vibrates at its third harmonic.

                 L2
      What is       ?
                 L1

            1
      A.
            3

      B.    1

      C.    2

      D.    3


18.   Two copper wires X and Y are connected in series. The diameter of Y is double that of X.
      The drift speed in X is v. What is the drift speed in Y?

            v
      A.
            4

            v
      B.
            2

      C.    2v

      D.    4v


19.   A wire of length L is used in an electric heater.  When the potential difference across the wire is
      200 V, the power dissipated in the wire is 1000 W.  The same potential difference is applied across
      a second similar wire of length 2L. What is the power dissipated in the second wire?

      A.    250 W

      B.    500 W

      C.    2000 W

      D.    4000 W
                                                  – 11 –                      N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

20.   A combination of four identical resistors each of resistance R are connected to a source of emf ε of
      negligible internal resistance. What is the current in the resistor X?

                                                       ε




                                                           X

            ε
      A.
            5R

            3ε
      B.
           10R

            2ε
      C.
            5R

            3ε
      D.
            5R


21.   Two parallel wires are perpendicular to the page.  The wires carry equal currents in
      opposite directions. Point S is at the same distance from both wires. What is the direction of
      the magnetic field at point S?

                                                           A.

                                                D.                   B.
                                                               S

                                                           C.

                                                                       X
                                conventional current               conventional current
                                    out of page                         into page




                                                                                                Turn over
                                                   – 12 –                N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

22.   A particle of mass m and charge of magnitude q enters a region of uniform magnetic field B that
      is directed into the page. The particle follows a circular path of radius R. What are the sign of the
      charge of the particle and the speed of the particle?




               Charge of the particle        Speed of the particle

                                                      qBR
      A.              positive
                                                       m


                                                      qBR
      B.              negative
                                                       m


                                                       qBR
      C.              negative
                                                        m


                                                       qBR
      D.              positive
                                                        m

23.   Two isolated point particles of mass 4M and 9M are separated by a distance 1 m.  A point particle
      of mass M is placed a distance x from the particle of mass 9M.  The net gravitational force on
      M is zero.

                        4M               M                   9M           not to scale


                                                    x

      What is x ?

            4
      A.      m
           13

            2
      B.      m
            5

            3
      C.      m
            5

            9
      D.      m
           13

24.   The graph shows the variation with time of the activity of a pure sample of a radioactive nuclide.
      What percentage of the nuclide remains after 200 s?

                            3.0
                            2.8
                            2.6
                            2.4
                            2.2
        activity / ×1022 Bq 2.0
                            1.8
                            1.6
                            1.4
                            1.2
                            1.0
                                  0     10        20       30        40       50       60       70
                                                             time / s

      A.   3.1 %

      B.   6.3 %

      C.   13 %

      D.   25 %
                                                        – 15 –                N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

25.   The graph shows the variation of the number of neutrons N with the atomic number Z for
      stable nuclei. The same scale is used in the N and Z axes.
                                      A.
                                                   N




                                                       45°
                                                                        Z


      Which information can be inferred from the graph?

		         I.          For stable nuclei with high Z, N is larger than Z.
		         II.         For stable nuclei with small Z, N = Z.
		         III.        All stable nuclei have more neutrons than protons.

      A.   I and II only

      B.   I and III only

      C.   II and III only

      D.   I, II and III


26.   Copper 64  (       )
              29 Cu decays to nickel         ( Ni) . What are the particles emitted and the particle that
                                              64
                                              28
      mediates the interaction?

                     Particles emitted        Mediating particle

      A.              β – and neutrino                 W+

      B.              β + and neutrino                 W–

      C.              β – and neutrino                 W–

      D.              β + and neutrino                 W+




                                                                                                      Turn over
                                                      – 16 –                 N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

27.   The following interaction is proposed between a proton and a pion.

                                            p +  +   π –     K –   +  π +

      The quark content of the π – is ud and the quark content of the K – is us.

      Three conservation rules are considered

		I.               baryon number
		II.              charge
		III.             strangeness.

      Which conservation rules are violated in this interaction?

      A.    I and II only

      B.    I and III only

      C.    II and III only

      D.    I, II and III


28.   What is the function of control rods in a nuclear power plant?

      A.    To slow neutrons down

      B.    To regulate fuel supply

      C.    To exchange thermal energy

      D.    To regulate the reaction rate


29.   A photovoltaic panel of area S has an efficiency of 20 %.  A second photovoltaic panel has
      an efficiency of 15 %.  What is the area of the second panel so that both panels produce the
      same power under the same conditions?

            S
      A.
            3

            3S
      B.
             4

            5S
      C.
             4

            4S
      D.
             3
                                                  – 17 –                N18/4/PHYSI/SPM/ENG/TZ0/XX

30.   Light of intensity I 0 is incident on a snow-covered area of Earth.  In a model of this situation,
      the albedo of the cloud is 0.30 and the albedo for the snow surface is 0.80.  What is the intensity
      of the light at P due to the incident ray I 0 ?



                                                            cloud

                                   I0


                                                                 P



                                                                           snow


      A.   0.14 I 0

      B.   0.24 I 0

      C.   0.50 I 0

      D.   0.55 I 0
